physical_examinations.relevant_findings: On admission, the patient was normothymic despite a recent depressive attack. Two weeks later, her condition included weeping, psychomotor retardation, anorexia, insomnia, and suicidal thoughts.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Her condition improved and cleared again in one week without treatment after the depressive episode.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Before discharge, the patient had been placed on a regimen of 36 hours of sleep deprivation per week for 10 weeks with no reported depressive relapses.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: She remained depression-free during the sleep deprivation treatment period.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: After being advised to discontinue sleep deprivation, the patient expressed concern about the recurrence of depression but remained free from depressive relapses two months post-treatment.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient successfully maintained a depression-free status for 8 months and 2 weeks during and after sleep deprivation treatment.
